t: Isaiah 65
I*p am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.
I*p have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walketh in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;
A*p people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars of brick;
Which*p remain among the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swine's flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;
Which*p say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the day.
Behold,*p it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

Your*p iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the Lord,*s which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.
Thus*p saith the Lord,*s As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants' sakes, that I may not destroy them all.
And*p I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.
And*p Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.
But*p ye are they that forsake the Lord,*s that forget my holy mountain, that prepare a table for that troop, and that furnish the drink offering unto that number.

Therefore*p will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.

Therefore*p thus saith the Lord God,*s Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:
Behold,*p my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.
And*p ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen: for the Lord God*s shall slay thee, and call his servants by another name:

That*p he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.
For,*p behold, I create new heavens and a new earth: and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.
But*p be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.
And*p I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.

There*p shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for the child shall die an hundred years old; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.
And*p they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.
They*p shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
They*p shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for they are the seed of the blessed of the Lord,*s and their offspring with them.
And*p it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.

The*p wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent's meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the Lord.*s
